definition: turn or go to the port or left side, of a ship, located on the left side of a ship or aircraft, (computer science) computer circuit consisting of the hardware and associated circuitry that links one device with another (especially a computer and a hard disk drive or other peripherals)
details:
verb
- turn or go to the port or left side, of a ship
= example: turn or go to the port or left side, of a ship
- land at or reach a port
= example: land at or reach a port
- bring to port
= example: bring to port
- put or turn on the left side, of a ship
= example: put or turn on the left side, of a ship
- modify (software) for use on a different machine or platform
- drink port
= example: drink port
- carry or hold with both hands diagonally across the body, especially of weapons
= example: carry or hold with both hands diagonally across the body, especially of weapons
- carry, bear, convey, or bring
= example: carry, bear, convey, or bring
adjective
- located on the left side of a ship or aircraft
= synonyms: larboard
noun
- (computer science) computer circuit consisting of the hardware and associated circuitry that links one device with another (especially a computer and a hard disk drive or other peripherals)
= synonyms: interface
- the left side of a ship or aircraft to someone who is aboard and facing the bow or nose
= synonyms: larboard
- an opening (in a wall or ship or armored vehicle) for firing through
= synonyms: embrasure, porthole
- sweet dark-red dessert wine originally from Portugal
= synonyms: port wine
- a place (seaport or airport) where people and merchandise can enter or leave a country
